page.title: 10Main drainage for East Stour
page.content: Many village houses are built of local stone from quarries long since worked out. One such old quarry at East Stour beside the A.30 road,has seen much activity lately.On the other side of the road,a new sewerage plant is being constructed. The spoil from the site is being taken by dumper trucks across the road to fill in the quarry.Here a bulldozer levels the earth and soon it will be dressed with topsoil and grass seed to become a field again. For more than a year the village streets have been opened up to lay the new pipes. East Stour looks forward to the end of 1985 when it will at last be on main drainage.
